title: Using Terraform to Quick Start PySpark on AWS
description: Step-by-step guide on how to use Terraform to spin up an EMR cluster with PySpark and Anaconda on AWS.

title: Deep Learning for Classifying Hotel Aesthetics Photos
description: At idealo.de we trained two Deep Neural Networks to assess the aesthetic and technical quality of images. Joint work with Christopher Lennan.

title: Falcon vs. Flask — Which one to pick to create a scalable deep learning REST API
description: Another comparison of two Python web frameworks — Flask and Falcon as a machine learning rest API.

title: What is Minimum Viable (Data) Product?
description: A personal view on what MVP means for machine learning products.

title: How you can ditch PowerPoint and build better slides with Jupyter and Reveal.js
description: In this article, I will introduce jupyter2slides — a little side project of mine that lets you easily create beautiful and interactive presentation slides using Jupyter Notebook and reveal.js.

title: Why the AI Hype Train is Already off the Rails and Why I’m Over AI Already
description: One data scientist on the hype around artificial intelligence.

title: How to train your own Object Detector with TensorFlow’s Object Detector API
description: This is a follow-up post on “Building a Real-Time Object Recognition App with Tensorflow and OpenCV” where I focus on training my own classes. Specifically, I trained my own Raccoon detector on a dataset that I collected and labeled by myself.

title: My two cents on what makes a good data scientist nowadays?
description: In this article, I explained what skills are important for data scientists these days.

title: Face2face — A Pix2Pix demo that mimics the facial expression of the German chancellor
description: Inspired by one of Gene Kogan’s workshop, I created my own face2face demo that translates my webcam image into the German chancellor when giving her New Year’s speech in 2017.

title: Building a Real-Time Object Recognition App with Tensorflow and OpenCV
description: In this article, I will walk through the steps how you can easily build your own real-time object recognition application with Tensorflow’s new Object Detection API and OpenCV in Python 3 (specifically 3.5).

title: Using Docker to Set Up a Deep Learning Environment on AWS
description: In this article, I will use docker, particularly nvidia-docker instead to simplify the installation process and therefore speed up the setup process.

title: Scoring at Scale with Keras and TensorFlow on Greenplum
description: How to train a deep neural network with Keras and TensorFlow and then apply it for scoring on Greenplum. Joint work with Kyle Dunn.

title: 8 “Simple” Guidelines For Data Projects
description: Advice for building impactful data products.

title: Continuous Integration for Data Science
description: This article will show why continuous integration is also important for smart apps projects.

title: Operationalizing PySpark Data Science Models on Pivotal Cloud Foundry
description: Demonstration of the Cloud Foundry buildpack for PySpark applications, in particular, to deploy a machine learning model trained in Spark. Joint work with Andreas Fleig.

title: How to Set Up a Deep Learning Environment on AWS with Keras/Theano
description: Step by step tutorial on how to set up a deep learning environment running on Amazon’s EC2 GPU instances.

title: Face Detection on Cloud Foundry
description: Deployment of a simple face detection web app using OpenCV on Cloud Foundry. Joint work with Andreas Fleig.

title: Quickstart PySpark with Anaconda on AWS
description: Step by step tutorial on how to bootstrap PySpark with Anaconda on AWS using boto3.

title: Delivery in a Land with No Postcodes
description: Automating the delivery location confirmation process with the help of machine learning for a logistic company operating in the Arab world where specifying a postcode won’t help much.

title: How Automakers And The Internet Of Things Are Colliding To Save Lives
description: Building a scalable IoT platform for one of the largest German car manufacturer that uses weather data and data from other cars to warn drivers of dangerous conditions.

title: Test-Driven Development for Data Science
description: Unravelling Test-Driven Development for Data Science. Joint work with Megha Agarwal.

title: API First for Data Science
description: How API first can help to create smart data-driven apps. Joint work with Alicia Bozyk.
